intro: Aethionema coridifolium, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of foliage on rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in early spring, which are clustered in racemes. Its leaves are fleshy and lobed, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Aethionema coridifolium is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
